paragraph.en-US: The Zombie is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Zombie, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Rotted Zombies within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
An animated corpse that moves shakily, driven only by hunger.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Devour, hungry, mob enemy, shred flesh

paragraph.en-US: When the Zombie is within Melee range of a creature and at least one other Zombie is within Close range, all attacks against that creature have advantage.
Targets who mark HP from the Zombie's attacks must also <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
A group of shambling corpses instinctively moving together.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Consume flesh, hunger, maul

paragraph.en-US: When the Zombies have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals <bold>1d4+2</bold> physical damage instead.
When the Zombies mark HP from an attack within Melee range, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack against the attacker.
A group of trained archers bearing massive bows.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Stick together, survive, volley fire

paragraph.en-US: When the Squadron has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals <bold>1d6+3</bold> physical damage instead.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to target a point within Far range. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Close range of that point. Targets the Squadron succeeds against take <bold>1d10+4</bold> physical damage.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to target a point within Far range. Until the next roll with Fear, a creature who moves within Close range of that point must make an Agility Reaction Roll. On a failure, they take <bold>2d6+3</bold> physical damage. On a success, they take half damage.
A young trainee eager to prove themselves.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Act reckless, kill, prove their worth, show off

paragraph.en-US: The Assassin is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Assassin, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Apprentice Assassins within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
A cunning scoundrel skilled in both poisons and ambushing.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Anticipate, get paid, kill, taint food and water

paragraph.en-US: Targets who mark HP from the Assassin's attacks are <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they clear a HP.
The Assassin has advantage on attacks if they are <italic>Hidden</italic>.

Drop a smoke bomb that fills the air within Close range with smoke, Dizzying all targets in this area. <italic>Dizzied</italic> targets have disadvantage on their next action roll, then clear the condition.
A seasoned killer with a threatening voice and a deadly blade.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Ambush, get out alive, kill, prepare for all scenarios

paragraph.en-US: The Assassin deals direct damage while they're <italic>Hidden</italic>.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to spotlight a number of other Assassins equal to the Assassin's unmarked Stress.
When the Assassin successfully makes a standard attack against a <italic>Vulnerable</italic> target, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage.
When the Assassin makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A cube-shaped construct with a different rune on each of their six sides.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Change tactics, trample foes, wait in disguise

paragraph.en-US: The Box can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> and roll a d6. The Box uses the corresponding move:

list.en-US: 1. Mana Beam. The Box fires a searing beam. Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, deal <bold>2d10+2</bold> magic damage.

2. Fire Jets. The Box shoots into the air, spinning and releasing jets of flame. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take <bold>2d8</bold> physical damage.

3. Trample. The Box rockets around erratically. Make an attack against all PCs within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take <bold>1d6+5</bold> physical damage and are <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until their next roll with Hope.
4. Shocking Gas. The Box sprays out a silver gas sparking with lightning. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll or <bold>mark 3 Stress</bold>.

5. Stunning Clap. The Box leaps and their sides clap, creating a small sonic boom. All targets within Very Close range must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll or become <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until the cube is defeated.

6. Psionic Whine. The Box releases a cluster of mechanical bees whose buzz rattles mortal minds. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll or take <bold>2d4+9</bold> direct magic damage.

paragraph.en-US: Before rolling damage for the Box's attack, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to add a d6 to the damage roll. Additionally, you gain a Fear.

When the Box marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or take <bold>2d8+1</bold> magic damage.
A floating humanoid skull animated by scintillating magic.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Cackle, consume magic, serve creator

paragraph.en-US: The Skull levitates several feet off the ground and can't be <italic>Restrained</italic>.
The Skull is resistant to magic damage.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Skull succeeds against take <bold>2d6+4</bold> magic damage.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to make an attack against a PC with a Spellcast trait within Very Close range. On a success, the target marks <bold>1d4</bold> Stress and the Skull clears that many Stress. Additionally, on a success, the Skull can immediately be spotlighted again.
A poorly trained civilian pressed into war.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Follow orders, gang up, survive

paragraph.en-US: The Conscript is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Conscript, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Conscripts within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 6 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
An accomplished manipulator and master of the social arts.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Entice, maneuver, secure patrons

paragraph.en-US: When a PC within Close range makes a Presence Roll, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to cast a gaze toward the aftermath. On the target's failure, they must <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold> and are <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until the scene ends or they succeed on a social action against the Courtesan. On the target's success, they must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
An experienced mage wielding shadow and fear.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Curry favor, hinder foes, uncover knowledge

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to make a standard attack against a target within range. On a success, the target must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to wrap an ally within Close range in a shroud of Protection until the Adept marks their last HP. While Protected, the target has resistance to all damage.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> and choose a point within Far range. All targets within Close range of that point are <italic>Restrained</italic> in smoky chains until they break free with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll. A target <italic>Restrained</italic> by this feature must <bold>spend a Hope</bold> to make an action roll.
Twice per scene, when a PC rolls a failure with Fear, clear a Stress.
A professional killer-turned-cultist.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Capture sacrifices, isolate prey, rise in the ranks

paragraph.en-US: The Fang can climb and walk on vertical surfaces. <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to move from one shadow to another within Far range.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to cause a target within Melee range to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target must <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold> and is teleported with the Fang to a shadow within Far range, making them temporarily <italic>Vulnerable</italic>. On a success, the target must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
A low-ranking cultist in simple robes, eager to gain power.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Follow orders, gain power, seek forbidden knowledge

paragraph.en-US: The Initiate is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Initiate, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Cult Initiates within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
Unnatural hounds lit from within by hellfire.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Cause fear, consume flesh, please masters

paragraph.en-US: When the Pack has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals <bold>2d4+1</bold> physical damage instead.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make all targets within Very Close range lose a Hope. If a target is not able to lose a Hope, they must instead <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold>.
When the Pack makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A swarm of eels that encircle and electrocute.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Avoid larger predators, shock prey, tear apart

paragraph.en-US: When the Eels have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals <bold>2d4+1</bold> physical damage instead.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. You gain a Fear for each target that marks HP.
An armored squire or experienced commoner looking to advance.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Gain glory, keep order, make alliances

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to move into Melee range of an ally and make a standard attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal <bold>2d10+2</bold> physical damage and the ally can clear a Stress.
When the Soldier is within Very Close range of a knight or other noble who would take damage, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to move into Melee range of them and take the damage instead.
A magical necromantic experiment gone wrong, leaving them warped and ungainly.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Devour, hunt, track

paragraph.en-US: The Experiment is resistant to physical damage.
When a target the Experiment attacks has other adversaries within Very Close range, the Experiment deals double damage.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to spotlight the Experiment as an additional GM move instead of spending Fear.
A leather-clad warrior bearing a whip and massive bow.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Command, make a living, maneuver, pin down, protect companion animals

paragraph.en-US: When the Beastmaster is spotlighted, you can also spotlight a Tier 1 animal adversary currently under their control.

Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to pin them to a nearby surface. The pinned target is <italic>Restrained</italic> until they break free with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll.
Twice per scene, summon a Bear, Dire Wolf, or similar Tier 1 animal adversary under the Beastmaster's control. The adversary appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.
An especially muscular giant wielding a warhammer larger than a human.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Make a living, overwhelm, slam, topple

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to have the Brawler charge at an inanimate object within Close range they could feasibly smash (such as a wall, cart, or market stand) and destroy it. All targets within Very Close range of the object must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take <bold>2d4+3</bold> physical damage from the shrapnel.

When the Brawler marks 2 or more HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can make a standard attack against the attacker. On a success, the Brawler deals <bold>2d6+15</bold> physical damage instead of their standard damage.
When the Brawler makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A giant fighter wearing borrowed armor.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Batter, make a living, overwhelm, terrify

paragraph.en-US: The Recruit is defeated when they take any damage. For every 7 damage a PC deals to the Recruit, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Recruits within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
A giant bird of prey with blood-stained talons.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Hunt prey, stay mobile, strike decisively

paragraph.en-US: While flying, the Eagle gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to attack a target within Far range. On a success, deal <bold>2d10+2</bold> physical damage and knock the target over, making them <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they next act.

Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal <bold>2d4+3</bold> physical damage and the target must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or become temporarily <italic>Restrained</italic> within the Eagle's massive talons. If the target is <italic>Restrained</italic>, the Eagle immediately lifts into the air to Very Far range above the battlefield while holding them.

While flying, the Eagle can drop a <italic>Restrained</italic> target they are holding. When dropped, the target is no longer <italic>Restrained</italic> but starts falling. If their fall isn't prevented during the PCs' next action, the target takes <bold>2d20</bold> physical damage when they land.
A snake-headed, scaled humanoid with a gilded bow, enraged that their peace has been disturbed.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Corner, hit-and-run, petrify, seek vengeance

paragraph.en-US: The Gorgon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
When the Gorgon makes a successful standard attack, the target Glows until the end of the scene and can't become <italic>Hidden</italic>. Attack rolls made against a Glowing target have advantage.

Make an attack roll against a target within Melee range using the Gorgon's protective snakes. On a success, <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to deal <bold>2d10+4</bold> physical damage and the target must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.

When the Gorgon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to force the attacker to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they begin to turn to stone, marking a HP and starting a Petrification Countdown (4). This countdown ticks down when the Gorgon is attacked. When it triggers, the target must make a death move. If the Gorgon is defeated, all petrification countdowns end.
When the Gorgon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A horse-sized insect with iridescent scales and crystalline wings moving faster than the eye can see.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Collect shiny things, hunt, swoop

paragraph.en-US: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
Before the Flickerfly makes an attack, roll a d6. On a result of 4 or higher, the target's Evasion is halved against this attack.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target's fears.

Countdown (Loop <bold>1d6</bold>). When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail must <bold>mark a Stress</bold> and lose a Hope.
A decorated soldier with heavy armor and a powerful steed.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Run down, seek glory, show dominance

paragraph.en-US: While the Knight is on a mount, they gain a +2 bonus to their Difficulty. When they take Severe damage, they're knocked from their mount and lose this benefit until they're next spotlighted.
When the Knight takes physical damage, reduce it by 3.
If the Knight is mounted, move up to Far range and make a standard attack against a target. On a success, deal <bold>2d8+4</bold> physical damage and the target must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to spotlight <bold>1d4+1</bold> allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.
A cunning thief with acrobatic skill and a flair for the dramatic.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Evade, hide, pilfer, profit

paragraph.en-US: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal <bold>1d8+2</bold> physical damage and the Thief steals one item or consumable from the target's inventory.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to reveal a snare trap set anywhere on the battlefield by the Thief. All targets within Very Close range of the trap must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be pulled off their feet and suspended upside down. A target is <italic>Restrained</italic> and <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll (13).
An accomplished merchant with a large operation under their command.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Abuse power, gather resources, mobilize minions

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to offer a target a dangerous bargain for something they want or need. If used on a PC, they must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failure, they must <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold> or take the deal.

name.en-US: The Best Muscle Money Can Buy - Action

paragraph.en-US: Once per scene, <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to summon <bold>1d4+1</bold> Tier 1 adversaries, who appear at Far range, to enforce the Baron's will.
A massive bull-headed firbolg with a quick temper.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Consume, gore, navigate, overpower, pursue

paragraph.en-US: You must <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to spotlight the Minotaur. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to charge through a group within Close range and make an attack against all targets in the Minotaur's path. Targets the Minotaur succeeds against take <bold>2d6+8</bold> physical damage and are knocked back to Very Far range. If a target is knocked into a solid object or another creature, they take an extra <bold>1d6</bold> damage (combine the damage).
Make an attack against a target within Very Close range, moving the Minotaur into Melee range of them. On a success, deal <bold>2d8</bold> direct physical damage.
An undead figure wearing a heavy leather coat, with searching eyes and a casually cruel demeanor.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Devour, hunt, track

paragraph.en-US: When the Hunter makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to curse a target within Very Close range with a necrotic Deathlock until the end of the scene. Attacks made by the Hunter against a Deathlocked target deal direct damage. The Hunter can only maintain one Deathlock at a time.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to spotlight <bold>1d4</bold> allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

Countdown (Loop <bold>1d6</bold>). When the Hunter is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, move the Hunter in a straight line to a point within Far range and make an attack against all targets in their path. Targets the Hunter succeeds against take <bold>2d8+2</bold> physical damage.
A high-ranking courtier with the ear of the local nobility.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Curry favor, manufacture evidence, scheme

paragraph.en-US: A PC who rolls less than 17 on an action roll targeting the Advisor must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to influence an NPC within Melee range with whispered words. That target's opinion on one matter shifts toward the Advisor's preference unless it is in direct opposition to the target's motives.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to convince a crowd or notable individual that one person or group is responsible for some problem facing the target. The target becomes hostile to the scapegoat until convinced of their innocence with a successful Presence Roll (17).
A clandestine leader with a direct channel to the Fallen Gods.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Amass great power, plot, take command

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Spend 2 Fear</bold> to spotlight <bold>1d4</bold> allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.
When you spotlight an ally within Far range, <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to gain a Fear.

Countdown (6). When the Secret-Keeper is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When they mark HP, tick down this countdown by the number of HP marked. When it triggers, summon a Minor Demon who appears at Close range.
Once per scene, when the Secret Keeper marks 2 or more HP, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to summon a Demonic Hound Pack, which appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.
A large aquatic predator, always on the move.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Find the blood, isolate prey, target the weak

paragraph.en-US: When the Shark makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

When the Shark makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

When a creature within Close range of the Shark marks HP from another creature's attack, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to immediately spotlight the Shark, moving them into Melee range of the target and making a standard attack.
A half-fish person with shimmering scales and an irresistible voice.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Consume, lure prey, subdue with song

paragraph.en-US: If the Siren makes a standard attack against a target <italic>Entranced</italic> by their song, the attack deals <bold>2d10+1</bold> damage instead of their standard damage.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to sing a song that affects all targets within Close range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or become <italic>Entranced</italic> until they <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold>. Other Sirens within Close range of the target can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to each add a +1 bonus to the Difficulty of the reaction roll. While <italic>Entranced</italic>, a target can't act and is <italic>Vulnerable</italic>.
A ghostly fighter with an ethereal bow, unable to move on while their charge is vulnerable.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Move through solid objects, stay out of the fray, rehash old battles

paragraph.en-US: The Archer has resistance to physical damage. <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to move up to Close range through solid objects.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to make an attack within Far range against a PC who is within Very Close range of at least two other PCs. On a success, the target takes <bold>2d8+12</bold> physical damage.
A ghostly commander leading their troops beyond death.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Move through solid objects, rally troops, rehash old battles

paragraph.en-US: The Captain has resistance to physical damage. <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to move up to Close range through solid objects.
<bold>Spend 2 Fear</bold> to return up to <bold>1d4+1</bold> defeated Spectral allies to the battle at the points where they first appeared (with no marked HP or Stress).
When the Captain's Spectral allies are forced to make a reaction roll, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to give those allies a +2 bonus to the roll.
When the Captain makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A ghostly fighter with spears and swords, anchored by duty.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Move through solid objects, protect treasure, rehash old battles

paragraph.en-US: The Guardian has resistance to physical damage. <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to move up to Close range through solid objects.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal <bold>2d10+6</bold> physical damage and the target must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
A skilled espionage agent with a knack for being in the right place to overhear secrets.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Cut and run, disguise appearance, eavesdrop

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to describe how the Spy knows a secret about a PC in the scene.

When a PC or group is discussing something sensitive, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to reveal that the Spy is present in the scene, observing them. If the Spy escapes the scene to report their findings, you gain <bold>1d4</bold> Fear.
A prowling hunter, like a slinking mountain lion, with a slate-gray stone body.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Defend territory, isolate prey, stalk

paragraph.en-US: The Stonewraith can move through stone and earth as easily as air. While within stone or earth, they are <italic>Hidden</italic> and immune to all damage.

While <italic>Hidden</italic>, <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to leap into Melee range with a target within Very Close range. The target must succeed on an Agility or Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take <bold>2d8</bold> physical damage and become temporarily <italic>Restrained</italic>.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to roar while within a cave and cause a cave-in. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take <bold>2d10</bold> physical damage. The rubble can be cleared with a Progress Countdown (8).
When the Stonewraith makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A battle-hardened mage trained in destructive magic.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Develop new spells, seek power, shatter formations

paragraph.en-US: Before or after making a standard attack, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to teleport to a location within Far range.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to refresh the Wizard's "Warding Sphere" reaction.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> and choose a point within Far range. A Very Close area around that point erupts into impassable terrain. All targets within that area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take <bold>2d10</bold> physical damage and are thrown out of the area. Targets who succeed take half damage and aren't moved.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to unleash a precise hail of magical blasts. All targets in the scene must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>2d12</bold> magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

When the Wizard takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal <bold>2d6</bold> magic damage to the attacker. This reaction can't be used again until the Wizard refreshes it with their "Refresh Warding Sphere" action.
A winged insect the size of a large house with iridescent scales and wings that move too fast to track.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Collect shiny things, hunt, nest, swoop

paragraph.en-US: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to four times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
When the Flickerfly makes an attack, the target's Evasion is halved against the attack.
While flying, the Flickerfly can move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to whirl, making an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Flickerfly succeeds against take <bold>3d8</bold> direct physical damage.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target's fears.

Countdown (Loop <bold>1d6</bold>). When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail lose<bold>2</bold>Hope and take <bold>3d8+3</bold> direct magic damage.
When the Flickerfly takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to take half damage.
A regal cloaked monstrosity with circular horns adorned with treasure.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Consume, fuel greed, sow dissent

paragraph.en-US: Attacks against the Demon are made with disadvantage unless the attacker spends a handful of gold. This Demon starts with a number of handfuls equal to the number of PCs. When a target marks HP from the Demon's standard attack, they can spend a handful of gold instead of marking HP (1 handful per HP). Add a handful of gold to the Demon for each handful of gold spent by PCs on this feature.
Add a bonus to the Demon's attack rolls equal to the number of handfuls of gold they have.
Spend 3 handfuls of gold (or a Fear) to spotlight <bold>1d4+1</bold> allies.
A cloaked demon-creature with long limbs, seeping shadows.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Make fear contagious, stick to the shadows, undermine resolve

paragraph.en-US: The Demon deals double damage to PCs with 0 Hope.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to weigh down the spirits of all PCs within Far range. All targets affected replace their Hope Die with a d8 until they roll a success with Hope or their next rest.

name.en-US: Your Friends Will Fail You - Reaction

paragraph.en-US: When a PC fails with Fear, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to cause all other PCs within Close range to lose a Hope.
When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A perfectly beautiful and infinitely cruel demon with a gleaming spear and elegant robes.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Condescend, declare premature victory, prove superiority

paragraph.en-US: When the Demon makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range must lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.
When a PC within Far range fails a roll, they can choose to reroll their Fear Die and take the new result. If they still fail, they <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold> and the Demon clears a Stress.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to deal the Demon's standard attack damage to a target within Close range.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to spotlight two other Demons within Far range.
When a PC fails a roll within Close range of the Demon, they must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
A fickle creature of spindly limbs and insatiable desires.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Join in on others' success, take what belongs to others, hold grudges

paragraph.en-US: The Demon's standard attack deals direct damage.
When the Demon marks HP from an attack, spend a number of Fear equal to the HP marked by the Demon to cause the attacker to mark the same number of HP.
When a creature within Close range takes damage from a different adversary, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to add a d4 to the damage roll.

When a PC takes Severe damage within Very Close range of the Demon, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to cause the target to make a Finesse Reaction Roll. On a failure, the Demon seizes one item or consumable of their choice from the target's inventory.
A hulking demon with boulder-sized fists, driven by endless rage.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Fuel anger, impress rivals, wreak havoc

paragraph.en-US: The Demon's attacks deal direct damage.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to boil the blood of all PCs within Far range. They use a d20 as their Fear Die until the end of the scene.
When the Demon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack against the attacker.

Countdown (Loop 6). Activate the first time an attack is made within sight of the Demon. It ticks down when a PC takes a violent action. When it triggers, summon <bold>1d4</bold> Minor Demons, who appear at Close range.
A wide-winged pet endlessly loyal to their vampire owner.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Dive-bomb, hide, protect leader

paragraph.en-US: While flying, the Bat gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to send a high-pitch screech out toward all targets in front of the Bat within Far range. Those targets must mark <bold>1d4</bold> Stress.

When an allied Vampire marks HP, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to fly into Melee range of the attacker and make an attack with advantage against them. On a success, deal <bold>2d6+2</bold> physical damage.
A nature spirit in the form of a humanoid tree.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Command, cultivate, drive out, preserve the forest

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to target a point within Far range. Create a patch of thorns that covers an area within Close range of that point. All targets within that area take <bold>2d6+2</bold> physical damage when they act. A target must succeed on a Finesse Roll or deal more than 20 damage to the Dryad with an attack to leave the area.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to grow three Treant Sapling Minions, who appear at Close range and immediately take the spotlight.
When an ally dies within Close range, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to clear<bold>2</bold>HP and 2 Stress as the fallen ally's life force is returned to the forest.
A blazing mote of elemental fire.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Blast, consume, gain mass

paragraph.en-US: The Elemental is defeated when they take any damage. For every 9 damage a PC deals to the Elemental, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Elemental Sparks within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
A living landslide of boulders and dust, as large as a house.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Avalanche, knock over, pummel

paragraph.en-US: When you spotlight the Elemental and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Elemental and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

When the Elemental makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.
An attack that would move the Elemental moves them two fewer ranges (for example, Far becomes Very Close). When the Elemental takes physical damage, reduce it by 7.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to create a rockslide that buries the land in front of Elemental within Close range with rockfall. All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (19). Targets who fail take <bold>2d12+5</bold> physical damage and become <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until their next roll with Hope. Targets who succeed take half damage.
When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A huge living wave that crashes down upon enemies.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Deluge, disperse, drown

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to attack a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal <bold>2d4+7</bold> physical damage and the target's next action has disadvantage. On a failure, the target must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against become <italic>Restrained</italic> and <italic>Vulnerable</italic> as they begin drowning. A target can break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll.
When the Elemental makes a successful standard attack, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to knock the target back to Close range.
A translucent green mound of acid taller than most humans.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Camouflage, creep up, envelop, multiply

paragraph.en-US: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze Envelops them and the target must <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold>. While Enveloped, the target must mark an additional Stress every time they make an action roll. When the Ooze takes Severe damage, all Enveloped targets are freed and the condition is cleared.
When the Ooze has 4 or more HP marked, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to split them into two Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.
A quadrupedal scaled beast with multiple long-necked heads, each filled with menacing fangs.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Devour, regenerate, terrify

paragraph.en-US: The Hydra begins with three heads and can have up to five. When the Hydra takes Major or greater damage, they lose a head.
The Hydra can be spotlighted X times per GM turn, where X is the Hydra's number of heads. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
If the Hydra has any marked HP, <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to clear a HP and grow two heads.
All PCs within Far range lose<bold>2</bold>Hope.

When the Hydra takes magic damage, they become <italic>Dazed</italic> until the next roll with Fear. While <italic>Dazed</italic>, they can't use their Regeneration action but are immune to magic damage.
The sovereign ruler of a nation, wreathed in the privilege of tradition and wielding unmatched power in their domain.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Control vassals, destroy rivals, forge a legacy

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> per PC in the party to have the group condemned for crimes real or imagined. A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll can demand trial by combat or another special form of trial.
Once per scene, <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to summon six Tier 3 Minions, who appear at Close range to enforce the Monarch's will.

Long-Term Countdown (8). <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to activate after the Monarch's desire for war is first revealed. When it triggers, the Monarch has a reason to rally the nation to war and the support to act on that reason. You gain <bold>1d4</bold> Fear.
A knight with huge, majestic antlers wearing armor made of dangerous thorns.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Isolate, maneuver, protect the forest, weed the unwelcome

paragraph.en-US: When the Knight succeeds on a standard attack from above a target, they deal <bold>3d12+3</bold> physical damage instead of their standard damage.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Knight succeeds against take physical damage equal to <bold>3d4</bold> + the target's Major threshold.
When the Knight takes damage from an attack within Melee range, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to deal <bold>1d10+5</bold> physical damage to the attacker.
A sturdy animate old-growth tree.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Hide in plain sight, preserve the forest, root down, swing branches

paragraph.en-US: Before they make their first attack in a fight or after they become <italic>Hidden</italic>, the Treant is indistinguishable from other trees until they next act or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll to identify them.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> and make an attack against up to three targets within Close range, pummeling them with giant acorns. Targets the Treant succeeds against take <bold>2d10+5</bold> physical damage.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to Root the Treant in place. The Treant is <italic>Restrained</italic> while Rooted, and can end this effect instead of moving while they are spotlighted. While Rooted, the Treant has resistance to physical damage.
A small, sentient tree sapling.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Blend in, preserve the forest, pummel, surround

paragraph.en-US: The Sapling is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Sapling, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Treant Saplings within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 8 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
A captivating undead dressed in aristocratic finery.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Create thralls, charm, command, fly, intimidate

paragraph.en-US: When the Vampire makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.
A creature who moves into Melee range of the Vampire must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, you gain <bold>1d4</bold> Fear.
When the Vampire is within Melee range of an ally, they can cause the ally to mark a HP. The Vampire then clears a HP.
<bold>Spend 2 Fear</bold> to summon <bold>1d4</bold> Vampires, who appear at Far range and immediately take the spotlight.
When the Vampire is spotlighted, roll a d8. On a result of 6 or higher, all targets within Very Close range must mark a HP.
An intelligent undead with blood-stained lips and a predator's smile.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Bite, charm, deceive, feed, intimidate

paragraph.en-US: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal <bold>5d4</bold> physical damage. A target who marks HP from this attack loses a Hope and must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>. The Vampire then clears a HP.
When the Vampire takes physical damage, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to take half damage.
A boxy, dust-covered construct with thick metallic swinging doors on their torso.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Carry away, entrap, protect, pummel

paragraph.en-US: Creatures within Melee range of the Gaoler have disadvantage on attack rolls against them. Creatures trapped inside the Gaoler are immune to this feature.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target is <italic>Restrained</italic> within the Gaoler until freed with a successful Strength Roll (18). While <italic>Restrained</italic>, the target can only attack the Gaoler.
A dust-covered golden construct with boxy limbs and a huge mace for a hand.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Destroy at any cost, expunge, protect

paragraph.en-US: Targets who take damage from the Sentinel's standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to choose a target within Very Close range to focus on. That target has disadvantage on attack rolls when they're within Very Close range of the Sentinel. The Sentinel can only focus on one target at a time.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to lob explosive magic at a point within Far range. All targets within Very Close range of that point must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>2d8+20</bold> magic damage and are knocked back to Close range. Targets who succeed take half damage and aren't knocked back.
When the Sentinel makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A massive living turret with reinforced armor and twelve piston driven mechanical legs.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Concentrate fire, lock down, mark, protect

paragraph.en-US: When you spotlight the Turret and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't make a standard attack. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Turret and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can attack.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to Mark a target within Far range until the Turret is destroyed or the <italic>Marked</italic> target becomes <italic>Hidden</italic>. While the target is <italic>Marked</italic>, their Evasion is halved.
When another adversary deals damage to a target within Far range of the Turret, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to add the Turret's standard attack damage to the damage roll.

When the Turret is destroyed, they explode. All targets within Close range must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>3d20</bold> physical damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.
A glacier-blue dragon with four powerful limbs and frost-tinged wings.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Avalanche, defend lair, fly, freeze, defend what is mine, maul

paragraph.en-US: The Dragon can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
If a target damaged by the Dragon doesn't mark an Armor Slot to reduce the damage, they must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
When a PC rolls with Fear while within Far range of the Dragon, they lose a Hope.

<bold>Spend 2 Fear</bold> to release an icy whorl in front of the Dragon within Close range. All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>4d6+5</bold> magic damage and are <italic>Restrained</italic> by ice until they break free with a successful Strength Roll. Targets who succeed must <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold> or take half damage.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to have the Dragon unleash a huge downfall of snow and ice, covering all other creatures within Far range. All targets within this area must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or be buried in snow and rocks, becoming <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they dig themselves out from the debris. For each PC that fails the reaction roll, you gain a Fear.

When a creature makes a successful attack against the Dragon from within Very Close range, they must <bold>mark a Stress</bold> and become <italic>Chilled</italic> until their next rest or they clear a Stress. While they are <italic>Chilled</italic>, they have disadvantage on attack rolls.
When the Dragon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A decaying mage adorned in dark, tattered robes.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Corrupt, decay, flee to fight another day, resurrect

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to spotlight <bold>1d4</bold> allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage, or full damage if you <bold>spend a Fear</bold>.

<bold>Mark 2 Stress</bold> to cause all targets within Far range to make a Strength Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>2d20+12</bold> magic damage and you gain a Fear. Targets who succeed take half damage. A target who marks 2 or more HP must also <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold> and becomes <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they roll with Hope.

name.en-US: Open the Gates of Death - Action

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to summon a Zombie Legion, which appears at Close range and immediately takes the spotlight.

When the Necromancer has marked 7 or more of their HP, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to have them teleport away to a safe location to recover. A PC who succeeds on an Instinct Roll can trace the teleportation magic to their destination.

Countdown (Loop <bold>2d6</bold>). When the Necromancer has marked 6 or more of their HP, activate the countdown. When it triggers, deal <bold>2d10+6</bold> direct magic damage to a target within Close range. The Necromancer then clears a number of Stress or HP equal to the number of HP marked by the target from this attack.
A cursed soul bound to the Fallen's will.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Crush, dominate, earn relief, punish

paragraph.en-US: The Shock Troop is defeated when they take any damage. For every 12 damage a PC deals to the Shock Troop, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.
When a PC marks HP from an attack by the Shock Troop, they lose a Hope.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Fallen Shock Troops within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 12 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
A powerful mage bound by the bargains they made in life.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Acquire, dishearten, dominate, torment

paragraph.en-US: <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to unleash an all-consuming firestorm and make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Sorcerer succeeds against take <bold>2d10+6</bold> direct magic damage.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to trap a target within Far range in a powerful illusion of their worst fears. While trapped, the target is <italic>Restrained</italic> and <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Instinct Roll.
When the Sorcerer takes damage from an attack, they can teleport up to Far range.

Countdown (Loop <bold>2d6</bold>). When the Sorcerer is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, all targets within Far range become <italic>Vulnerable</italic> and must <bold>mark a Stress</bold> as they relive their greatest regrets. A target can break free from their regret with a successful Presence or Strength Roll. When a PC fails to break free, they lose a Hope.
A Fallen God, wreathed in rage and resentment, bearing millennia of experience in breaking heroes' spirits.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Corrupt, dominate, punish, break the weak

paragraph.en-US: The Realm-Breaker can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
When the Realm-Breaker takes damage, reduce it by <bold>2d10</bold>.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. When a target uses armor to reduce damage from this attack, they must mark 2 Armor Slots.

Countdown (Decreasing 8). When the Realm-Breaker is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, create a torrent of incarnate rage that rends flesh from bone. All targets within Far range must make a Presence Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>2d6+10</bold> direct magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage. For each HP marked from this damage, summon a Fallen Shock Troop within Very Close range of the target who marked that HP. If the countdown ever decreases its maximum value to 0, the Realm-Breaker marks their remaining HP and all targets within Far range must mark all remaining HP and make a death move.
When a target marks HP from an attack by the Realm-Breaker, all PCs within Far range of the target must lose a Hope.

name.en-US: I Have Never Known Defeat (Phase Change) - Reaction

paragraph.en-US: When the Realm-Breaker marks their last HP, replace them with the Undefeated Champion and immediately spotlight them.
That which only the most feared have a chance to fear.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Dispatch merciless death, punish the defiant, secure victory at any cost

paragraph.en-US: The Undefeated Champion can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
When the Undefeated Champion takes damage, reduce it by <bold>1d10</bold>.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. PCs the Champion succeeds against lose a number of Hope equal to the HP they marked from this attack.
<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to summon a number of Fallen Shock Troops equal to twice the number of PCs. The Shock Troops appear at Far range.

Countdown (<bold>1d8</bold>). When the Undefeated Champion is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, activate a magical circle covering an area within Far range of the Champion. A target within that area is <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they leave the circle. The circle can be removed by dealing Severe damage to the Undefeated Champion.
When the Undefeated Champion makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
When a target marks HP from an attack by the Undefeated Champion, all PCs within Far range of the target lose a Hope.
Spirit soldiers with sanctified bows.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Focus fire, obey, reposition, volley

paragraph.en-US: The Archer deals double damage to targets marked Guilty by a High Seraph.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack against up to three targets.
Souls of the faithful, lifted up with divine weaponry.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Obey, outmaneuver, punish, swarm

paragraph.en-US: The Soldier is defeated when they take any damage. For every 13 damage a PC deals to the Soldier, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.
While the Soldier is flying, <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Hallowed Soldiers within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 10 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
A divine champion, head of a hallowed host of warriors who enforce their god's will.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Enforce dogma, fly, pronounce judgment, smite

paragraph.en-US: The Seraph can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
While the Seraph is flying, <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to make a target Guilty in the eyes of the Seraph's god until the Seraph is defeated. While Guilty, the target doesn't gain Hope on a result with Hope. When the Seraph succeeds on a standard attack against a Guilty target, they deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage. The Seraph can only mark one target at a time.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to reflect a sliver of divinity as a searing beam of light that hits up to twenty targets within Very Far range. Targets must make a Presence Reaction Roll, with disadvantage if they are marked Guilty. Targets who fail take <bold>4d6+12</bold> magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.
Once per scene, <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to spotlight all other adversaries within Far range. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.
A legendary beast of the sea, bigger than the largest galleon, with sucker-laden tentacles and a terrifying maw.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Consume, crush, drown, grapple

paragraph.en-US: The Kraken can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
While the Kraken has 7 or fewer marked HP, they can make their standard attack against two targets within range.

Make an attack roll against a target within Close range. On a success, <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to grab them with a tentacle and drag them beneath the water. The target is <italic>Restrained</italic> and <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they break free with a successful Strength Roll or the Kraken takes Major or greater damage. While <italic>Restrained</italic> and <italic>Vulnerable</italic> in this way, a target must <bold>mark a Stress</bold> when they make an action roll.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to spew a line of boiling water at any number of targets in a line up to Far range. All targets must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take <bold>4d6+9</bold> physical damage. If a target marks an Armor Slot to reduce the damage, they must also <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
When the Kraken makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.
A towering immortal and incarnation of fate, cursed to only see bad outcomes.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Change environment, condemn, dishearten, toss aside

paragraph.en-US: When the Oracle makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.
When a creature rolls a failure while within Very Far range of the Oracle, they must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to present a target within Far range with a vision of their personal nightmare. The target must make a Knowledge Reaction Roll. On a failure, they lose all Hope and take <bold>2d20+4</bold> direct magic damage. On a success, they take half damage and lose a Hope.
Once per day, <bold>spend 2 Fear</bold> to summon <bold>2d4</bold> Tier 2 or below Minions relevant to one of the PC's personal nightmares. They appear at Close range relative to that PC.
When the Oracle sees a mortal creature, they instantly know one of their personal nightmares.
When the Oracle marks HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to knock the attacker back to Far range and deal <bold>2d10+4</bold> physical damage.
A chaotic mockery of life, constantly in flux.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Demolish, devour, undermine

paragraph.en-US: When the Abomination attacks, roll <bold>2d4</bold> and use the result as their attack modifier.
When a target takes damage from the Abomination, they must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they gain disadvantage on their next action roll and you gain a Fear.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to rattle the edges of reality within Far range of the Abomination. All targets within that area must succeed on a Knowledge Reaction Roll or become <italic>Unstuck</italic> from reality until the end of the scene. When an <italic>Unstuck</italic> target spends Hope or marks Armor Slots, HP, or Stress, they must double the amount spent or marked.
When the Abomination takes damage, reduce it by <bold>1d20</bold>. If the Abomination marks 1 or fewer Hit Points from a successful attack against them, you gain a Fear.
A shifting, formless mass seemingly made of chromatic light.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Confuse, distract, overwhelm

paragraph.en-US: When a PC takes damage from the Corrupter, they lose a Hope.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to spew partially digested portions of consumed realities at all targets within Close range. Targets must succeed on a Knowledge Reaction Roll or <bold>mark 2 Stress</bold>.
A vaguely humanoid form stripped of memory and identity.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Destroy, disgust, disorient, intimidate

paragraph.en-US: The Thrall is defeated when they take any damage. For every 13 damage a PC deals to the Thrall, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to choose a target and spotlight all Outer Realm Thralls within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 11 physical damage each. Combine this damage.
A massive winged creature with obsidian scales and impossibly sharp claws.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Defend lair, dive-bomb, fly, hunt, intimidate

paragraph.en-US: The Obsidian Predator can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
While flying, the Obsidian Predator gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.
The Obsidian Predator is resistant to physical damage.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Obsidian Predator succeeds against take <bold>4d6+4</bold> physical damage and are knocked back to Far range and <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until their next roll with Hope.

If the Obsidian Predator is flying, <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to choose a point within Far range. Move to that point and make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Obsidian Predator succeeds against take <bold>2d10+6</bold> physical damage and must <bold>mark a Stress</bold> and lose a Hope.
When the Obsidian Predator marks their last HP, replace them with the Molten Scourge and immediately spotlight them.
Enraged by their wounds, the dragon bursts into molten lava.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Douse with lava, incinerate, repel Invaders, reposition

paragraph.en-US: The Molten Scourge can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
When the Molten Scourge takes damage, roll a number of d6s equal to HP marked. For each result of 4 or higher, you gain a Fear.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target takes <bold>4d8+1</bold> physical damage, loses a Hope, and is knocked back to Close range. The Molten Scourge clears a Stress.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to erupt lava from beneath the Molten Scourge's scales, filling the area within Very Close range with molten lava. All targets in that area must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take <bold>4d6+6</bold> physical damage and be knocked back to Close range. This area remains lava. When a creature other than the Molten Scourge enters that area or acts while inside of it, they must mark 6 HP.

When the Molten Scourge takes Major damage, roll a d10. On a result of 8 or higher, the Molten Scourge breathes a flow of lava in front of them within Far range. All targets in that area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>2d10+4</bold> physical damage, mark <bold>1d4</bold> Stress, and are <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until they clear a Stress. Targets who succeed take half damage and must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.
When the Molten Scourge takes Severe damage from an attack within Very Close range, molten blood gushes from the wound and deals <bold>2d10+4</bold> direct physical damage to the attacker.
When the Molten Scourge marks their last HP, replace them with the Ashen Tyrant and immediately spotlight them.
No enemy has ever had the insolence to wound the dragon so. As the lava settles, it's ground to ash like the dragon's past foes.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Choke, fly, intimidate, kill or be killed

paragraph.en-US: The Ashen Tyrant can be spotlighted up to four times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> instead of spending a Fear to spotlight the Ashen Tyrant.
While flying, the Ashen Tyrant gains a +1 bonus to their Difficulty.
When a PC rolls a failure while within Close range of the Ashen Tyrant, they lose a Hope and you gain a Fear. If the PC can't lose a Hope, they must mark a HP.

<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Ashen Tyrant succeeds against take <bold>2d20+2</bold> physical damage, are knocked back to Close range of where they were, and must <bold>mark a Stress</bold>.

<bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to smash the ground and kick up ash within Far range. While within the ash cloud, a target has disadvantage on action rolls. The ash cloud clears the next time an adversary is spotlighted.

Countdown (<bold>1d12</bold>). <bold>Spend a Fear</bold> to activate. It ticks down when a PC rolls with Fear. When it triggers, the Ashen Tyrant thrashes about, causing environmental damage (such as an earthquake, avalanche, or collapsing walls). All targets within Far range must make a Strength Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take <bold>2d10+10</bold> physical damage and are <italic>Restrained</italic> by the rubble until they break free with a successful Strength Roll. Targets who succeed take half damage. If the Ashen Tyrant is defeated while this countdown is active, trigger the countdown immediately as the destruction caused by their death throes.
A towering, muscular zombie with magically infused strength and skill.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Consume, hound, maim, terrify

paragraph.en-US: When the Zombie makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.
PCs can't spend Hope to use features against the Zombie.
<bold>Mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Zombie succeeds against are <italic>Vulnerable</italic> until their next rest.
When another adversary deals damage to a target within Very Close range of the Zombie, you can <bold>spend a Fear</bold> to add the Zombie's standard attack damage to the damage roll.
A large pack of undead, still powerful despite their rotting flesh.

motivesAndTactics.en-US: Consume brain, shred flesh, surround

paragraph.en-US: When the Legion has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals <bold>2d6+5</bold> physical damage instead.
The Legion has resistance to physical damage.
The Legion can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.
When the Legion takes Minor damage from an attack within Melee range, you can <bold>mark a Stress</bold> to make a standard attack with advantage against the attacker.
